source_sentence: 如是乃至樓至如來，功德圓滿住最後身，在賢劫中，於此三千大千世界當成佛者，
translation: Thus it will be until the final body of the Tathāgata Ruci Buddha, whose virtue is perfect and abides in his last body. In the world age of the wise he will become a buddha in this universe consisting of one-thousand great chiliocosms.

source_sentence: 我悉為母。
translation: I'm all my mother.

source_sentence: 如於此三千大千世界，如是於此華藏莊嚴世界海，一切世界種中所有世界，
translation: “Furthermore, just as in this universe Array of Flower Treasury is the ocean of worlds called A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, so are all the worlds therein.

source_sentence: 一一四天下閻浮提內，乃至十方一切世界海，其中所有一切世界，盡未來際一切劫中，
translation: In each of the four continents on earth, all the oceans of worlds in the ten directions, and all the worlds therein, throughout all the ages to come.

source_sentence: 諸有修行普賢行願，為欲調伏諸眾生故，以自在力現受生時，我自見身悉為其母。」
translation: Those who cultivate the practice of Samantabhadra's vow want to tame sentient beings, so when they are born with unimpeded power, I myself see my body as their mother.

source_sentence: 爾時，善財童子白摩耶夫人言：「大聖！
translation: It was then that the boy of good fortune said to Lady Maya, Great sage!

source_sentence: 得此菩薩大願智幻莊嚴解脫，經幾時耶？」
translation: How long did it take to attain this bodhisattva's great vow, wisdom, illusory adornment, and liberation?

source_sentence: 答言：「善男子！
translation: He replied, Good man!

source_sentence: 乃往古世，過不思議非最後身菩薩神通道眼所知劫數，爾時有劫，名為淨光，
translation: In ancient times there was an inconceivable number of eons, not counted by the eye of enlightening beings in the final body. At that time there was an eon called Pure Light,

source_sentence: 世界名須彌德；
translation: The world is called Sumeru Virtue.

source_sentence: 雖有諸山，五趣雜居，然其國土無諸穢惡；
translation: Although there are mountains and the five realms of rebirth live together, that land has no defilement.

source_sentence: 眾寶所成，清淨圓滿，莊嚴可愛；
translation: It is made of myriad jewels, pure and full, beautifully adorned and pleasing.

source_sentence: 彼世界中，有千億四天下；
translation: In that world there were a thousand koṭis of the four continents.

source_sentence: 有一四天下，名香風威德師子幢，於中有八十億王城；
translation: There was a fourth continent called Fragrant Wind, the mighty lion Banner of Fragrance and Virtue, in which there were eighty billion royal cities.

source_sentence: 中有一城，名最勝具足幢；
translation: In the middle was a city called Supreme Array of Banners.

source_sentence: 有轉輪王，名勇猛精進大威德；
translation: There was a wheel-turning king called Courageous Energy of Great Majestic Power.

source_sentence: 彼王城北有一道場，名種種妙色光；
translation: To the north of that royal city there was a square called Various Lights of Marvelous Form.

source_sentence: 其道場神名吉祥眼。
translation: The deity at the site of enlightenment is called Auspicious Eye.

source_sentence: 時有菩薩名無垢幢，坐於道場將成正覺，有一惡魔名金色光，與其眷屬無量魔軍，
translation: At that time an enlightening being named Banner of Immaculate Conception was sitting on the terrace of enlightenment, about to become perfectly enlightened. There was a devil spirit called Golden Light, accompanied by innumerable hosts of demons,

source_sentence: 種種形狀，至菩薩所欲為壞亂；
translation: Their various forms are disintegrating as soon as the enlightening beings desire them.

source_sentence: 彼轉輪王已得菩薩神通自在，以大神變，為欲摧碎彼魔軍故，化大兵眾，
translation: That wheel-turning king, having attained the mastery of enlightening beings’ spiritual powers, transformed his great army with great mystic displays in order to destroy the armies of Māra.

source_sentence: 其數倍多，圍遶道場，諸魔惶怖，悉自奔散，故彼菩薩，得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Because of this, the bodhisattva attained anuttara samyaksarrzbodhi.

source_sentence: 時道場神見是事已，歡喜無量，便於彼王而生子想。
translation: When the deity at the site of enlightenment saw this, he rejoiced immeasurably and gave rise to the thought of that king as his child.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，作是願言：『此大威德轉輪聖王，在在生處，常為我子，乃至成佛，
translation: They bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and made the following vow: This majestic wheel-turning sage king will always be my heir, whether born or not.

source_sentence: 願我常得與其為母。』
translation: May I always be able to give it to him as my mother.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，於此道場復曾值遇十那由他佛，承事供養，令生歡喜。
translation: Having made this vow, they once again encountered ten buddhas at the site of enlightenment and served and offered support to them, causing them to become joyous.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼道場神豈異人乎？
translation: Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is

source_sentence: 我身是也。
translation: This is the self-body.

source_sentence: 轉輪王者，今世尊毘盧遮那如來、應、正等覺是。
translation: The wheel-turning king is the present Bhagavān, Vairocana Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One.

source_sentence: 我從於彼發願已來，此佛世尊，於十方剎一切諸趣，處處受生，勇猛精進，
translation: “Furthermore, World-honored One, since I have undertaken this vow from that buddha, I have been born everywhere in all the worlds of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 種諸善根，供養如來，修菩薩行，教化成熟一切眾生，乃至示現住最後身，
translation: They plant roots of goodness, honoring buddhas, cultivating enlightening practices, teaching and developing all sentient beings, until they appear in their final bodies.

source_sentence: 念念普於十方世界，示現菩薩受生神變，常為我子，我常為母。
translation: Every moment of thought, throughout the worlds of the ten directions, they show the miraculous transformations of enlightening beings undergoing birth as my children and I am always their mother.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 過去、現在十方無量一切世界，諸佛如來將成佛時，皆於臍中出現種種廣大光明，
translation: In all the infinite worlds of the ten directions, past, present, and future, when the Buddhas were about to become buddhas, various vast rays of light appeared in their navels.

source_sentence: 來照我身，及我眷屬所居宮殿；
translation: They came to illumine my body and the palaces where I live.

source_sentence: 彼最後身，我悉為母。
translation: In their last body, I'm the mother.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我唯知此菩薩大願智幻莊嚴解脫門。
translation: “I only know this enlightening liberation of the great vows, knowledge, illusions, and adornments of these bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 如諸菩薩摩訶薩具大悲藏，以一切智，教化調伏一切眾生，常無厭倦；
translation: “Good son, it is as if great enlightening beings possess the treasury of great compassion and use omniscience to edify and tame all sentient beings, always tirelessly.

source_sentence: 住安忍行，恒知止足；
translation: Abiding in the practice of patience, they always know contentment.

source_sentence: 服甘露味，心無有盡；
translation: Their minds were filled with the taste of immortality, and their hearts had no limit.

source_sentence: 一切眾魔及諸惡人不能擾亂，心無動搖，心無輕躁，心無高下，心無諂幻，
translation: All demons and evil people can’t disturb them, their minds are not agitated, their minds are not lax, their minds are not high or low, and their minds are not flattering or illusory.

source_sentence: 無稠林行，念念得入百千三昧，念念得見百千諸佛，念念得知百千佛力，
translation: In each thought he saw hundreds of thousands of buddhas, and in each thought he perceived the power of a hundred thousand buddhas.

source_sentence: 念念能動百千世界，念念遊履百千佛剎，念念光照百千世界，念念成熟百千眾生，
translation: In each thought he can move a hundred thousand worlds, and in each thought he travels to a hundred thousand buddha-lands. In each thought his light illumines a hundred thousand worlds, and in each thought he develops a hundred thousand sentient beings.

source_sentence: 念念自在住百千劫，念念深入過去、未來各百千劫，念念深解百千法門，
translation: Each moment of thought remains unimpeded for a hundred thousand eons, and each moment penetrates deeply into the past and future one hundred thousand eons. In each moment of thought they enter deeply into a hundred thousand teachings.

source_sentence: 念念示現百千佛身，念念示現百千菩薩以為眷屬。
translation: Each thought shows a hundred thousand buddha bodies, and each thought shows a hundred thousand bodhisattvas as their retinues.

source_sentence: 以自在力，念念普於一一毛孔，示現無量諸佛神變，於三寶所，究竟成就，
translation: In each hair pore he manifested innumerable mystical displays of buddhas, all accomplished at the place of the Triple Gem.

source_sentence: 深信不壞。
translation: They're deeply convinced that they won't break down.

source_sentence: 善巧了知種種諸行生滅分位，善巧了知種種諸法本性無生，善巧了知種種世間轉變成壞，
translation: They skillfully know the various states of arising and ceasing of conditioned phenomena; they skillfully know that the essence of all things is essentially non-arising; they skillfully know the various worlds are becoming and decaying.

source_sentence: 善巧了知種種諸業受生差別，善巧了知種種生死涅槃邊際，善巧了知種種佛剎染淨不同，
translation: They skillfully know the various distinctions in actions, births, and rebirths; they skillfully know the various states of transmigration and nirvana; they skillfully know the differences in defilement and purity of the various buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 善巧了知過去、未來一切菩薩種種修習，善巧了知一切諸法無相無盡，
translation: They skillfully know all past and future enlightening beings’ various practices; they skillfully know all things are signless and inexhaustible.

source_sentence: 而我云何能知、能說彼諸菩薩行智功德？
translation: How can I know and explain the merit of the knowledge of the practices of those bodhisattvas?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 此三十三天，有王名具足正念；
translation: In these thirty-three heavens there is a king named Perfectly Awakened One.

source_sentence: 其王有女，名天主光。
translation: The king had a daughter named Devānām-Indraprabhāsa.

source_sentence: 汝詣彼問菩薩云何學菩薩行，修菩薩道。」
translation: Go there and ask the bodhisattva how to train in the bodhisattva practice and cultivate the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 時，善財童子敬受其教，頭面禮足，遶無數匝，慇懃戀慕，一心瞻仰，
translation: Then Sudhana paid his respects to the monk Supratishthita and, venerating him by bowing his forehead at his feet, circled him countless times.

source_sentence: 辭退而去。
translation: He withdrew and departed.

source_sentence: ◎◎爾時，善財順知識教，遂即往詣三十三天具足正念天王宮中，見彼天女，
translation: At that time, following the instruction of his spiritual benefactor, Sudhana went to the palace of the heavenly king Sthavira in the realm of the thirty-three gods and saw the celestial maidens.

source_sentence: 禮足圍遶，合掌前住，白言：「聖者！
translation: Surrounded by him, he joined his palms and stood in front of him, saying, Sage!

source_sentence: 我已先發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，而未知菩薩云何學菩薩行？
translation: I've previously aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, but I don't know how an enlightening being is to train in the practice of enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 云何修菩薩道？
translation: How do they cultivate the path of enlightening beings?

source_sentence: 我聞聖者善能誘誨，願為我說。」
translation: I've heard that the noble one is good at encouraging, so please tell me about it.

source_sentence: 天女告言：「善男子！
translation: The goddess told them, Good man!

source_sentence: 我得菩薩無礙念清淨莊嚴解脫門。」
translation: I've attained the liberation gate of the pure adornment of unobstructed mindfulness of bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 善財白言：「聖者！
translation: Shanzai said, Sage!

source_sentence: 此解脫門境界云何？
translation: What is the sphere of this gate of liberation?

source_sentence: 修行何法得此解脫？」
translation: What is the way to cultivate practice and attain this liberation?

source_sentence: 天女答言：「善男子！
translation: The goddess replied, Good man!

source_sentence: 菩薩勤修無量不思議法門，得此解脫。
translation: A bodhisattva diligently cultivates measureless, inconceivable dharmas and attains this liberation.

source_sentence: 汝若欲入此解脫門，亦當如是精勤修學。
translation: If you want to enter this gate of liberation, you should also thus diligently cultivate it.

source_sentence: 云何勤修不思議法門？
translation: How do you diligently cultivate the inconceivable dharma-gate?

source_sentence: 所謂：汝應勤修不可思議諸法義智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate knowledge of the meaning of inconceivable truths.

source_sentence: 謂如實覺悟一切諸法，差別、性相、真實體故。
translation: It's because they truly awaken to all dharmas, which are distinct, by their nature and true essence.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修守護正法；
translation: You should diligently practice protecting the true teaching.

source_sentence: 謂種種妙法為人誹謗，以理摧伏顯勝義故。
translation: It means that various wonderful dharmas are denigrated by people because the principle subdues and reveals their ultimate meaning.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修表、無表戒；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the morality that is manifest and the morality that is unmanifest.

source_sentence: 謂若性、若遮、有罪、無罪，微細觀察無缺減故。
translation: It means that whether it's inherent, obstructed, blameworthy, or blameless, there's no lack of subtle observation.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修無諍訟法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the principle of noncontention.

source_sentence: 謂世間種種綺雜言說，無益集會常遠離故。
translation: It means that the various kinds of fancy speech in the world are unbeneficial, collected, and always far removed.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修住安忍地；
translation: You should diligently cultivate and abide in the state of patience.

source_sentence: 謂種種苦惱逼迫身心，審諦觀察能忍受故。
translation: It means that the body and mind are oppressed by various kinds of suffering and distress, because they can tolerate it with careful observation.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修忍耐諸境；
translation: You should diligently cultivate patience regarding all objects.

source_sentence: 謂惡言毀辱、怨結毒害，不壞內心常安忍故。
translation: It's because bad speech, disgrace, and the poisonous bond of enmity won't harm them, and their internal minds are always peaceful and patient.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修解微細法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate understanding of subtle principles.

source_sentence: 謂知蘊、界、處，流轉還滅，善了性相不可得故。
translation: It means that they know the aggregates, realms, and locations, which flow back and forth and cease because they well understand their nature and characteristics are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 「汝應勤修善巧法句；
translation: “You should diligently cultivate the words of skillful means.

source_sentence: 謂巧能宣說種種法門，真實性相令顯現故。
translation: They are the ability to skillfully expound various teachings, because they reveal their true nature and characteristics.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修合不合法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate unlawful conjunction.

source_sentence: 謂了知諸法性不可奪，亦無增減離合等故。
translation: It means that they understand that the nature of dharmas cannot be grasped, and there is no increase or decrease apart from conjunction.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修觀過去智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate knowledge regarding the past.

source_sentence: 謂微細觀察種種業因，善惡等相無不知故。
translation: It means subtly observing the causes of various actions, such as good and bad characteristics without not knowing them.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修未來際智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate knowledge of the future.

source_sentence: 謂微細觀察種種業緣，果報等相無不知故。
translation: It means that subtly observing various karmic conditions, such as the characteristics of retribution and so forth, without not knowing.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修三世平等；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the equality of all times.

source_sentence: 謂三世行相雖各不同，但隨住法有差別故。
translation: It means that although the characteristics of the three time periods are different, there are distinctions in the dharmas that follow their continuance.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修三輪清淨；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the purity of the three wheels.

source_sentence: 謂過、現、未來一切諸法，性不可得離心意故。
translation: It means that all dharmas in the past, present, and future are inherently ungraspable because they can't be free of mind and thought.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修心住處法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the principle of abiding in awarenesses.

source_sentence: 謂普遍了知內、外、中間，心相本性不可得故。
translation: It means that they universally perceive internal, external, and intermediate minds because the original nature of mind and its characteristics are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修守護威儀；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the deportment of guardianship.

source_sentence: 謂一切時中微細觀察，身、口、意業不迷惑故。
translation: It means subtle observation at all times, because bodily, verbal, and mental actions aren't confused.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修清淨威儀；
translation: You should diligently cultivate pure manners of deportment.

source_sentence: 謂密護根門，藏覆善法，所有不善恒發露故。
translation: It's because the approach of guarding the faculties is hidden, hiding good qualities that are unwholesome and always revealing them.

source_sentence: 「汝應勤修離不善法；
translation: “You should diligently cultivate detachment from unwholesome states.

source_sentence: 謂愚癡凡夫種種惡法，不與共住常覺悟故。
translation: It means that the various bad qualities of foolish worldlings don't live together with them and are always awakened.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修集菩薩行；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the practice of enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 謂普遍了知勇猛精進，難行能行種種行故。
translation: It means that they universally perceive courageous effort, because it's difficult to practice and capable of practicing various practices.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修恭敬尊長；
translation: You should diligently cultivate reverence and respect for the venerable ones.

source_sentence: 謂床座供具給侍奉迎，身心謙下無懈怠故。
translation: It's because a bed, seat, offerings, and an attendant are offered to greet him, and he's humble in body and mind without laziness.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修攝持身心；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the discipline of maintaining body and mind.

source_sentence: 謂普能攝持諸清淨法，不失不壞常了知故。
translation: It's the ability to universally embrace and maintain pure dharmas, which are not lost or destroyed and always known.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修隨順覺智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the knowledge of following enlightenment.

source_sentence: 謂於諸世間、出世間法，隨順性相而覺悟故。
translation: It's because they are enlightened by following the nature and characteristics of worldly and transmundane dharmas.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修入甚深法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate entry into the profound truth.

source_sentence: 謂了達一切生滅法相，令心增長無生智故。
translation: It's the understanding of all the characteristics of arising and ceasing dharmas that causes the mind to grow the cognition of nonarising.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修音聲法智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate knowledge of the principles of voice and sound.

source_sentence: 謂如實演說種種法門，開示語言真實性故。
translation: It's because they truly explain the various teachings, revealing the true nature of language.

source_sentence: 「汝應勤修遠離無益；
translation: “You should diligently cultivate detachment from uselessness.

source_sentence: 謂以諸方便令自及他，超過諸有無益法故。
translation: It means to cause oneself and others by means of skillful means to surpass the useless dharmas that exist.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修丈夫集會；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the assembly of men.

source_sentence: 謂諸佛、菩薩、聲聞、獨覺，親近承事常供養故。
translation: It's because the buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekbuddhas are intimately served and always offered support.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修遠惡知識；
translation: You should diligently cultivate detachment from bad companions.

source_sentence: 謂遠離樂起斷常諸見，及嬾惰等惡眾生故。
translation: It's because they're free of the views of happiness that give rise to nihilism and permanence, and bad sentient beings like idleness.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修不依凡夫；
translation: You should diligently cultivate it, not relying on worldlings.

source_sentence: 謂見凡夫法，皆與愚癡而共相應，多過失故。
translation: It means that views of worldlings and dharmas are all associated with delusion, because they have many faults.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修常不輕心；
translation: You should diligently cultivate constancy and not despise others.

source_sentence: 謂於諸眾生了性平等，不於貧下生輕賤故。
translation: It means that the nature of sentient beings is perceived to be equal because they don't give rise to despise those who are poor and inferior.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修愍破戒者；
translation: You should diligently cultivate discipline for those who violate the precept against sexual misconduct.

source_sentence: 謂以大慈悲拔濟犯罪，安置菩薩淨戒中故。
translation: It's because they rescue crimes with great compassion and place them in the bodhisattva's pure precepts.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修增慈悲力；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the power of increasing kindness and compassion.

source_sentence: 謂觀察十方三世眾生，種種逼迫能救護故。
translation: It's observing sentient beings in the ten directions and three worlds who are variously oppressed and able to rescue them.

source_sentence: 「汝應勤修財法攝受；
translation: “You should diligently cultivate the principle of collecting wealth.

source_sentence: 謂財物飲食攝諸眾生，令入甚深真實法故。
translation: It's because possessions, food, and drink gather sentient beings into the profound true teaching.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修如說能行；
translation: You should diligently cultivate practice as you have been taught and be able to do.

source_sentence: 謂修種種善開發自心，具足敷榮得圓滿故。
translation: It means cultivating various kinds of well-developed self-mind, which are endowed with prosperity and attain their fulfillment.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修昔相應善；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the goodness associated with the past.

source_sentence: 謂求宿住智善巧多聞，能知過去相應行故。
translation: It means seeking knowledge of past lives and being skillful and well-versed, which enables one to know the past actions associated with them.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修樂獨善寂；
translation: You should diligently cultivate bliss and solitary, wholesome quiescence.

source_sentence: 謂遠離處眾諸雜談說，常樂親近白淨法故。
translation: It's because they're far removed from the many miscellaneous talks and always delight in being intimate with white pure dharmas.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修少欲知足；
translation: You should diligently cultivate contentment with few desires.

source_sentence: 謂衣服、飲食、臥具、醫藥，自作教他知止足故。
translation: It's because clothing, food, drink, bedding, and medicine are self-produced and taught to others to know that they're satisfied.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修相應行法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the practices associated with enlightenment.

source_sentence: 謂三十七品菩提分法，常勤修習令相應故。
translation: It means the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, which are always diligently cultivated and made to be associated.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修菩薩行境；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the sphere of practice of enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 謂十波羅蜜一切行門，具足修習令圓滿故。
translation: It means all the practices of the ten perfections, which are fully cultivated and made complete.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修菩薩地法；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the practice of enlightening beings’ state.

source_sentence: 謂十種智地入住及出相，及得果皆證知故。
translation: It means that the ten kinds of stages of knowledge are entering, leaving, and attaining their fruit because they all realize it.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修入如來地；
translation: You should diligently cultivate entering the sphere of buddhahood.

source_sentence: 謂若菩提智及所斷障，種種體用皆證得故。
translation: It means that if the knowledge of enlightenment and the hindrances that are eliminated are various in essence and function, they'll all realize them.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修難了知法；
translation: You should diligently practice the teaching that is difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 謂諸佛、菩薩、獨覺、聲聞，皆悉了知不思議故。
translation: It means the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas all fully understand it because it's inconceivable.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修不取諸相；
translation: You should diligently practice not grasping characteristics.

source_sentence: 謂修習覺悟諸法性相，如幻如夢同實相故。
translation: It's the cultivation of awakening to the characteristics of the nature of dharmas, which are illusory and dreamlike in their true characteristics.

source_sentence: 汝應勤修解脫法智；
translation: You should diligently cultivate the knowledge of the principles of liberation.

source_sentence: 謂金剛三昧散壞塵習，澄靜妄念智不動故。
translation: It means that the adamantine absorption disintegrates the accumulations of dust, because it clarifies and calms deluded thoughts and wisdom without moving.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 有如是等佛剎極微塵數不可思議種種法門，我皆勤修得此解脫，汝能修行亦當證得。
translation: There are inconceivable various teachings like these as numerous as atoms in a buddha-land, which I diligently cultivate to attain this liberation; you can cultivate them and realize them.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝向所問解脫境界，我此解脫境界無邊。
translation: You've asked about the sphere of liberation, but my sphere of liberation has no limit.

source_sentence: 又，善男子！
translation: Furthermore, good man!

source_sentence: 我以得此解脫力故，憶念古世，爾時有劫名優鉢羅華，於彼劫中，承事供養恒河沙數諸佛如來。
translation: Because of the power of attaining this liberation, I remember ancient times when there was an eon called Upālika in which I served and honored buddhas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 彼諸如來，從初出家，我皆瞻奉守護供養，造僧伽藍，營辦資具。
translation: Those tathāgatas have all renounced the householder’s life since their inception. I serve, protect, and pay homage to them by building a monastery and providing necessary provisions for it.

source_sentence: 又彼如來從為菩薩入母胎時，誕生之時，行七步時，師子吼時，童子位時，
translation: “Furthermore, the Tathāgata descended from his mother’s womb at the time of the bodhisattva Vaiśravaṇa and entered her. When he was born, when he walked seven paces, when the lion roared, and when he was a young child,

source_sentence: 處宮中時，厭棄王位初出家時，詣菩提樹成正覺時，轉正法輪，現佛神變，
translation: When he was in the palace, disillusioned with the king’s throne and leaving home for the first time, he went to the bodhi tree to attain enlightenment, turned the wheel of the true teaching, and manifested the buddha-transformation.

source_sentence: 教化調伏諸眾生時；
translation: When they teach and tame sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如是一切諸所作事，從初發心行菩薩道，乃至法盡，我皆明記無有遺餘，
translation: All these things that I do, from the first determination for enlightenment up to the end of the Teaching, I clearly remember without any residue.

source_sentence: 常現在前念持不忘。
translation: He always presents it in front of them and remembers it without forgetting it.

source_sentence: 又憶過去劫名善地，我於彼劫，復得值遇十恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: Also, remembering that past eon as a good land, I'll again be able to meet the buddhas and tathāgatas as numerous as the grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers who served and supported me during that eon.

source_sentence: 復憶有劫，名為妙德，於彼值遇十佛世界極微塵數諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: Again, I remember an eon called Marvelous Virtue in which I met as many buddha-tathāgatas there as atoms in ten buddha-lands and served and honored them.

source_sentence: 又憶往劫，名無所得，於彼值遇八十百千億那由他諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: I also remember an eon in the past called nongrasping, when I met eighty-thousand koṭis of nayutas of buddha-tathāgatas there and served and supported them.

source_sentence: 復憶有劫，名為妙光，於彼值遇閻浮提極微塵數諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: I also remember another eon, called Marvelous Light, in which I met as many buddha-tathāgatas there as atoms in Jambudvfpa, serving and honoring them.

source_sentence: 復憶往劫，名無稱光，於彼值遇二十恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: I also remember an eon of the past, called Light of Immeasurable fame, in which I encountered buddhas as numerous as the grains of sand in twenty Ganges Rivers and served and supported them.

source_sentence: 復憶往劫，名最勝吉祥，於彼值遇一恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: He also remembered an eon in the past called Supreme Auspicious, when he happened to meet a buddha named Tathāgata as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River there and served and supported him.

source_sentence: 復憶往劫，名出現日，於彼值遇八十恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: Again, I remember an eon in the past called the appearance day when I happened to meet buddhas as numerous as the grains of sand in eighty Ganges Rivers at that place and served and supported them.

source_sentence: 復憶往劫，名勝性遊行，於彼值遇六十恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: I also remember an eon of the past called Vaiśravaṇa, when I happened to meet buddhas as numerous as the number of grains of sand in sixty Ganges Rivers there and served and supported them.

source_sentence: 復憶有劫，名為妙月，於彼值遇七十恒河沙諸佛如來，承事供養。
translation: Again, I remember an eon called the Marvelous Moon in which I met seventy buddha-tathāgatas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River and served and supported them.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如是憶念恒河沙劫，我常不離諸佛如來、應、正等覺，種種方便恭敬供養，
translation: “In this way I remember the past eons as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, for which I have always honored and served buddhas by various means.

source_sentence: 從彼一切諸如來所，皆得聞此無礙念清淨莊嚴菩薩解脫，聞已受持，如說修行，
translation: “From the presence of all those buddhas they hear this liberation of enlightening being Adorned with Unobstructed Mindfulness, pure and genuine. Having heard it, they retain it and practice it according to its instructions.

source_sentence: 恒不忘失；
translation: They never forget or lose it.

source_sentence: 如是往劫所有如來，從初發心乃至法盡，諸所作事，我皆以此清淨莊嚴解脫之力，
translation: “All the deeds of past buddhas, from their initial determination for enlightenment up to the exhaustion of all teachings, I did by means of the power of liberation adorned with purity.

source_sentence: 隨順憶念，明了現前，持而順行，念念觀察，曾無懈廢。
translation: He follows recollection, clearly comprehends what’s present, maintains it, and follows it; he observes it moment after moment without laziness.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我唯知此無礙念清淨莊嚴菩薩解脫，如諸菩薩摩訶薩，出生死夜，朗然明徹，
translation: “I only know this liberation of the enlightening being Adorned with Unobstructed Mindfulness, pure and genuine: just as all the great enlightening beings in the night of birth and death clearly penetrate it.

source_sentence: 永離癡冥，未嘗昏寐，心無諸蓋，身行輕安，於諸法性，清淨覺了，決擇甚深修多羅藏，
translation: They are forever free from the darkness of ignorance, never falling asleep. Their minds have no hindrances, and their bodily actions are light and peaceful. They clearly perceive and understand the essence of all dharmas and decide on the profound treasury of scriptures.

source_sentence: 了不了義一切難處，善護自他，常勤修習菩薩淨戒，若利非利心恒平等，
translation: Understanding all difficulties of meaning, they protect themselves and others well, always diligently cultivating the pure precepts of enlightening beings. Their minds are always impartial to those who seek benefit or not benefit.

source_sentence: 善巧出生神通妙智，隨順世間種種方便，增長福慧心無厭足，起大精進勤修助道，
translation: They skillfully produce subtle knowledge of mystical powers, adapting to the various methods of the world, increasing their minds of virtue and wisdom without weariness, producing great energy diligently cultivating the aids to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 積集慈悲心無厭倦，成就如來十力無畏，十八不共一切佛法，隨順開悟一切眾生，
translation: They accumulate kindness and compassion without weariness of mind, perfecting the ten powers of enlightenment, having no fear. Eighteen unique qualities common to all buddhas, they follow and enlighten all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 晝夜精勤更無餘念，而我云何能知、能說彼功德行？
translation: Day and night, he exerts himself with no residual thoughts, but how can I know or tell of his meritorious deeds?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 此迦毘羅城，有童子師名為遍友，汝詣彼問菩薩云何學菩薩行，修菩薩道。」
translation: In this city of Kapilavastu, there's a boy named pervasive friend called Pervading Friend, so go to him and ask the bodhisattva how he trains in the bodhisattva practice and cultivates the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 時，善財童子以聞法故，歡喜踊躍，不思議善根速疾增長，頂禮其足，
translation: Then Sudhana paid his respects to the monk Supratishthita and bowed his head at his feet. Having heard the teaching, Sudhana was delighted and jumped for joy.

source_sentence: 遶無數匝，慇懃瞻仰，辭退而去。
translation: They circled him innumerable times, looked at him with veneration, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，善財從天宮下，向迦毘羅城，詣遍友所，禮足右遶，合掌恭敬，
translation: At that time Sudhana went to Kapilavastu from the celestial palace, paid his respects, and greeted Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra.

source_sentence: 於一面立，白言：「聖者！
translation: He stood to one side and said, Sage!

source_sentence: 我已先發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，而未知菩薩云何學菩薩行，云何修菩薩道；
translation: I have set my mind on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 我聞聖者善能誘誨，願為我說。」
translation: I've heard that the noble one is good at encouraging, so please tell me about it.

source_sentence: 遍友答言：「善男子！
translation: Pūrṇa replied, Good man!

source_sentence: 此有童子名善知眾藝，修學菩薩字智法門。
translation: Here there's a boy named Sunetra who well knows all arts and cultivates the bodhisattva-syllable wisdom dharma-gate.

source_sentence: 汝可問之，當為汝說。」
translation: You may ask about it, and I'll explain it for you.

translation: “I only know this liberation, just as the great enlightening beings are able to distinguish all worldly and transmundane ways of skillful means.

source_sentence: 文字算數，咸綜無遺。
translation: The written and calculated languages are all collected together without exception.

source_sentence: 又善了知醫方呪術；
translation: They also had detailed knowledge of the magical spells for healing illnesses.

source_sentence: 有諸眾生、鬼魅所持，怨憎呪詛，妖幻所迷，死屍奔逐，癲癎羸瘦，及諸蠱毒，
translation: There are sentient beings and ghosts holding grudges, spells, spells, demons, illusions, dead corpses chasing after them, seizures, hunger, thinness, and poison.

source_sentence: 種種異疾，咸能救之，使得痊愈。
translation: He was cured of various ailments and enabled to be cured.

source_sentence: 又善別知殊珍異貨；
translation: They are also good at distinguishing rare and precious treasures.

source_sentence: 金、玉、珠、貝、珊瑚、瑠璃、摩尼、硨磲、玻瓈、碼碯、銅、鐵、鉛、錫、雞薩羅等，
translation: gold, jade, pearls, shellfish, coral, lapis lazuli, maṇi, brass, crystal, emerald, copper, iron, lead, tin, kośala, and so forth.

source_sentence: 一切寶藏出生之處，品類不同，價直多少。
translation: Where all the treasure treasuries are produced, they are of different kinds and priced at different amounts.

source_sentence: 村營國邑，大小都城，宮殿苑園，巖泉藪澤，凡是一切人眾所居，菩薩咸能隨方攝護。
translation: All the villages, towns, cities, palaces, parks, cliffs, fountains, and marshes wherever the bodhisattvas can take care of them in any direction.

source_sentence: 又知其身，具有六百六十三相，於諸相中，校其優劣，知其苦樂，定其吉凶，
translation: He also knows the six hundred and sixty-three distinctive marks of his body. He judges the superiority and inferiority of these marks to determine whether they are auspicious or not.

source_sentence: 辨其脩短。
translation: He identifies the shortcomings of his cultivation.

source_sentence: 雖具眾相，不及好聲；
translation: Even though it has all the characteristics of a buddha, it is not as good as its sound.

source_sentence: 雖多好聲，不如勝福；
translation: Even though it has a lot of good sound, it is not as good as the best fortune.

source_sentence: 及知此福，所修之業，可轉不轉定不定報。
translation: And knowing this merit, the karma cultivated can be transformed or not transformed, and it's determined or not determined as its reward.

source_sentence: 又善觀察天文地理，讖緯陰陽，人相吉凶，惡星變怪，雲霞氣候，鳥獸音聲，
translation: Also, he observed the signs of good and bad omens with knowledge of astronomy and geography, as well as the moon, moons, latitudes, and yin and yang. He also observed the signs of good and bad omens for humans and bad omens for animals.

source_sentence: 水陸往還，徵應休咎，年穀豐儉，國土安危。
translation: The water and the land flowed back and forth in an unhurried manner. Crops and grains were abundant and the country was peaceful and prosperous.

source_sentence: 如是世間所有藝能，靡不該練盡其源本。
translation: Thus, all the arts and abilities in the world can't be cultivated without exhausting their source.

source_sentence: 又能分別出世之法；
translation: They were also able to distinguish transmundane dharmas.

source_sentence: 正名辨義，觀察體相，微細甚深，決擇宣說，隨順修行，智入其中，無疑無礙，
translation: They correctly name and explain meaning, observing the essence and characteristics, subtle and profound, they analyze and expound with discernment, following and cultivating practice. Their knowledge enters into them without doubt or hindrance.

source_sentence: 無愚闇，無頑鈍，無憂惱，無沈沒，無不現證。
translation: They have no ignorance, no stubbornness, no grief, no torpor, no sinking, and no non-manifest realization.

source_sentence: 而我云何能知、能說彼功德行？
translation: How can I know and explain their meritorious actions?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 此摩竭提國有一聚落，名為有義。
translation: In this country of Magadha, there's a village named meaningful.

source_sentence: 彼中有城，名婆怛那。
translation: There's a city there named Vātsīputrīya.

source_sentence: 有優婆夷，名最勝賢，汝詣彼問菩薩云何學菩薩行，修菩薩道。」
translation: There's an Upāsikā named Most Excellent Wisdom, so go there and ask the bodhisattva how to train in the bodhisattva practice and cultivate the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 時，善財童子禮眾藝足，遶無數匝，慇懃瞻仰，一心戀慕，辭退而去。
translation: Then Sudhana paid his respects and departed. Having saluted the feet of the goddess, he circumambulated her innumerable times. He looked up at the queen’s body and said, “I am going to see you.” Thereupon, Bodhisattva Sadāparibhūta paid his respects with one-pointed reverence and left.
